dialog: I would like to partake in an American-style breakfast, including fried eggs with the yolks facing upwards.
And what type of juice would you prefer, good sir?
A juice to accompany breakfast and a black coffee, brewed extra strong, if you please.
Very good, sir. An American breakfast with sunny-side-up fried eggs, breakfast juice, and a strong black coffee. Is that correct, sir?
Indeed, that is correct.
Would there be anything else, sir?
No, that shall be all. Thank you.
Good morning, sir. Your requested breakfast has arrived.
Just place it on the table, if you would be so kind.
Is there anything else I can bring you, sir?
No, thank you. Ah, wait, could I trouble you for some juice to stock the minibar?
Certainly, sir. Which type of juice would you prefer: tomato or orange?
Tomato or orange juice, if you please.
At once, sir. Could you sign this bill first, please? Thank you, sir.
Shall we leave a gratuity? This service has been quite excellent.
I believe so. How much is considered standard?
How about a ten percent tip? That would come to around six galleons.
That seems fair and reasonable.
When does the train for Tibet depart, may I ask?
It shall depart at three in the afternoon, good sir or madam.
